issue.title: [9.0.0] Bazel 8 hangs during build event upload

labels.name: P1
labels.description: I'll work on this now. (Assignee required)

labels.name: team-Remote-Exec
labels.description: Issues and PRs for the Execution (Remote) team

milestone.title: 9.0.0 release blockers
milestone.description: Issues that should be fixed before 9.0.0 release.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
### Description of the bug:


I'm seeing an intermittent issue where a build will fail to exit after uploading build events. Seems like Bazel is waiting for background upload tasks even though they have all completed.

### Which category does this issue belong to?

Core

### What's the simplest, easiest way to reproduce this bug? Please provide a minimal example if possible.


This happens intermittently and I haven't found a straightforward repro.

### Which operating system are you running Bazel on?


Amazon Linux 2023.6.20250115

### What is the output of `bazel info release`?


release 8.0.1

### If `bazel info release` returns `development version` or `(@non-git)`, tell us how you built Bazel.


_No response_

### What's the output of `git remote get-url origin; git rev-parse HEAD` ?


```text

```

### If this is a regression, please try to identify the Bazel commit where the bug was introduced with bazelisk --bisect.


_No response_

### Have you found anything relevant by searching the web?

Seems potentially related to https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/21626 but I'm not using remote execution.

### Any other information, logs, or outputs that you want to share?

[jstack dump](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18710658/jstack-l.txt)

issue.title: Fix crash on lost inputs that are symlinks

labels.name: team-Remote-Exec
labels.description: Issues and PRs for the Execution (Remote) team

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
The downloads in `AbstractActionInputPrefetcher#prefetchInputs` reported lost inputs that are symlinks to other artifacts with the exec path of the target, which results in a crash when the target is not also an input to the action. This is fixed by always reporting the exec path of the symlink.

Fixes #25841

body: @iancha1992 This is a regression that results in a crash when certain files are evicted by the remote cache. I would lean towards fixing this in a patch release.
